reviews.review:
As a player who plays both killer and survivor, killer has been less and less appealing to play. The only times i have fun in the game is when I'm playing with my friends as survivor.There are multiple issues current in the game, map design and the lac of fun killers to play as /against, just to name a few. 

Even though the game is riddled with these issues, I can't help but play the game. Not only is the game addicting once you get in but Behavior has made it a lot easier for new players to get started on their journey towards killer or survivor. I can say for a fact that bringing in some new friends to play DBD has not only introduced them into a fun and exciting game but helped me rediscover why I love this game so much.

No matter how bad the state of the game is, I can't seem to stop playing. DBD has become one of my most played games and I love this community, the good and the bad.
10/10 love being a cripple and crouching everywhere against the hag, thanks behaviour
Excelent game, very fun to play with friends and random people, lots of adrenaline and jump scares lol, definatly a must for all terror lovers, no way to go wrong with it
Really fun game when you're playing with friends, a bit frustrating when your an alone survivor.

===[ Overall Score ]===
**** 8/10 ***

Comments :

- Scary in the beginning, being monotonous later.
- Needs grinding lots of bloodpoints for being good as old players.
- Well designed killers.
- All survivors are the same because of the perk system, no role assignment.
- Some perks are very good, some perks are very trash. Needs a better balancement.
- Really long matchmaking time when matchmaking as killer.
- Playerbase was good in 2 years ago, now so much kids trying to harras gameplay.
- Game has some cheaters.
Great game, but it takes a while to get used to the game. Also, there is a high chance you will come up against some really annoying players.
